org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Alphabet
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The Arabic alphabet was developed in the Middle East on the basis of the Phoenician alphabet. Typical features for them are writing from right to left and omitting vowels. Long vowels and diphthongs are paralleled to consonants and, thus, they are written. There are separate characters for short vowels and they are written above or below consonants. They are not used in normal writing, except in the Koran and in children's school books. Due to Islam, the Arabic alphabet has been introduced, for example, into Persian and Urdu. The Arabic language has 28 letters, which each have four characters depending on whether the letter is independent and whether it is at the beginning, end or middle of a word.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Treasures
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Treasures can be found in the graves of the Assyrian god kings. The graves of the Assyrian god kings contain immeasurable riches: gold, precious stones, fetishes and works of art. They are the graves of the first seven Assyrian kings, Ashurbanipal, Tiglath-Pileser I, Eriba-Adad I, Puzur-Ashur III and Sargon I. Hints about these graves can be obtained from saints or witches. You can also try to find pieces of maps in churches, mosques and museums.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: AH/BH
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: After Hijra, for example, 500 AH = 1120's AD. The Hijra year can be calculated by using the formula: 2005 AD – 622 = 1383 AH. In the Islamic countries, the calendar begins from 621 AD when Mohammed moved from Mecca to Medina.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Amulet
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Amulets are objects, which are believed to protect their bearer from sickness, accidents and witchcraft. They can be sentences from Koran written on paper and placed inside a locket, pieces of mirror or other such things. In this game, the Fatima's hand and Fatima's eye, which were known already before Islamic time, are used. They will protect you from a witch's curse, bad luck and evil eye.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Anjudan
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Hasan-i-Sabah is also known as the Old Man of the Mountain. He built the famous Alamut fortress from which he controlled the Central Asian politics by means of assassinations and intrigue. It is rumoured that he is immortal and that in his Alamut fortress, his soldiers have the pleasures of the paradise in their use. In this game, he has started to build new fortresses. One of these is being built near the city of Anjudan.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Bazaar
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The bazaar is the heart of Baghdad. You can buy and sell spice seeds and seedlings here. You can buy horses and some luxury products. Abroad, the corresponding place is the city's market place.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Borak
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the Islamic mythology, Borak is a monster, part human, part animal, whose name means lightning. Mohammed rode on his back on the night when he stepped into heaven. In the game, Borak is Mahdi's and Hafaza's steed, which they can give to your use.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Daevas
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the Zarathustran religion, the daevas are spirits, who are the children of Bad thoughts, Lies and Pride. They have allied themselves with Iblis to fight against Allah. In the game, they are lower level mythical helpers.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Dzinn
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the Zarathustran religion, the daevas are spirits, who are the children of Bad thoughts, Lies and Pride. They have allied themselves with Iblis to fight against Allah. In the game, they are lower level mythical helpers.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Hermitage
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the folk art of the Muslim countries, there are often symbols that protect you from the evil eye: one of the most common is Fatima's hand. Pieces of mirror, turqoise stones or turqoise color can also be used for the same purpose. In the Islamic world, Fatima is the daughter of Mohammed and she has also been revered as a saint. In the game, the Fatima's hand will protect you from evil eye, curses and bad dzinns.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Fatima's hand
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the folk art of the Muslim countries, there are often symbols that protect you from the evil eye: one of the most common is Fatima's hand. Pieces of mirror, turqoise stones or turqoise color can also be used for the same purpose. In the Islamic world, Fatima is the daughter of Mohammed and she has also been revered as a saint. In the game, the Fatima's hand will protect you from evil eye, curses and bad dzinns.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Fatima's eye
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the folk art of the Muslim countries, there are often symbols that protect you from the evil eye: one of the most common is Fatima's eye. Pieces of mirror, turqoise stones or turqoise color can also be used for the same purpose. In the Islamic world, Fatima is the daughter of Mohammed and she has also been revered as a saint. In the game, the Fatima's eye will protect you from evil eye, curses and bad dzinns.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Hafaza
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the Islamic mythology, Hafaza is an angel who protects people from bad dzinns. Each person has four Hafazas of which two are in guard at the daytime and two at night. They also keep a record of the person's good and bad deeds. In the game, Hafaza is a higher level mythical helper who is on the side of Allah. At the end of the game, he will tell you what kind of life you lived in the game.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Hashish
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Hashish is Arabic and means grass. The narcotic properties of Cannabis sativa have been known already to the doctors and botanists in the classical times. "There is a third type of hemp, which is called Indian hemp. It is strongly intoxicating even if you take only one drachm of it," Ibn al-Baytar (d. 626 AH). "For a long time we had heard unbelievable stories of the miraculous effect of hashish. We only knew about the hallucinations caused by opium. Of hashish, we only knew the name," Théophile Gautier (1189-1257 AH).

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Silver dirham
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In Baghdad, the money used is the silver dirham that is of Hellenistic origin. Also in use is the gold solidus from Byzantium: 1 Byzantine gold solidus 10 silver dirhams.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Gazebo
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can build yourself a gazebo. In the gazebo, you can have parties and spend time peaceful moments with your wife.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Drugs
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can buy and sell hashish and opium. Drug trade will make you rich faster than the spice trade. Opium is more valuable than hashish. However, the drug trade has its risks: you may get yourself killed, you may get cheated or you may become addicted to drugs. You will find drug dealers in the Sheitan’s Bazaar.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Iblis
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Iblis is the Islamic satan, who is the father of the bad dzinns. Iblis can command spirits convert and eliminate leaders and protect you from rat packs. As a reward, he always demands a sacrifice. Iblis is a higher level mythical helper, who fights against Allah.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Iblis' spell
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: With the Iblis' spell, you can change yourself into a devil's dog and move at the same speed as with Suleiman or Borak.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Parties
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can have parties that will increase your influence. The parties can be in the pub or in your wedding. For parties, you need to buy food, some luxury products. You just have to call for musicians.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Cardemon
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The cardemon bush, Elettaria cardamomum, is a relative of ginger and grows to the height of about three meters in the rain forests of its native country of India. It is used most in the Arab countries, where it is used to spice coffee. After saffron and vanilla, cardemon is the third most expensive spice in the world and the price encourages the use of substitutes. The Arab merchants sold cardemon to Europeans for a high price. They kept it strictly secret where they got the spice.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Maps
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the game, you can search for pieces of maps that will help you to find graves of Assyrian god kings. Each map has been divided into four sections. When you have collected all sections, you will find the treasure.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Merchant
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the bazaar, you can buy various items from a merchant, such as seeds, spices and luxury items. You can also hire yourself a merchant to take care of your business at home or abroad.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Porcelain
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Porcelain objects are luxury items, which you can buy and sell in the bazaar. Mostly they have been made in Esfahan or China. You can also display them in museums. Luxury items can also be used for trying to bribe people.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Library
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Building a library in your home country will increase your influence. You can also place your book collections in your European museums. If your business expands too much abroad, you may be accused of disregarding your own culture. The accusations will stop when you build a library to your own city.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Jewelry
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Pieces of jewelry are luxury items, which you can buy and sell in the bazaar. Mostly they have been made in Esfahan or India. You can also display them in museums. Luxury items can also be used for trying to bribe people.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Konya
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The city of Konya is located in the present day Turkey, beside the Taurus Mountains. Dzalaladdin Rumi is a Persian Sufi saint, who lived the rest of his life in Konya and founded his own Sufi sect there. Nowadays, we know this sect for its "whirling dervishes". Dzalaladdin Rumi is called Mevlana, which means "our Lord". The grave of Mevlana, located in Konya, is an important place of pilgrimage for the Shi'a Muslims.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Home in Baghdad
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Your home is located at the outskirts of Baghdad. You have a small house with two rooms and a backyard surrounded by a wall. When you get wealthier, you can see your growing property at your home. First, it will change into a mansion and then into a palace. Your home is the place where you future wife will move into.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Bribe
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can use bribes to hasten the granting of permits and processing of matters. The probability of success depends on the size of the bribe.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Love potion
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can buy love potion from a witch to convert people to your side. It will also help you to get a wife or new friends.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Business premises
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In your own country, your business premises are at your home. You can also hire a merchant to take care of your business. Abroad, business premises can be rented from the palace of the city.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Moving
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the game, you can move by walking, caravan, horse or ship. On land, walking is the slowest way to move and horse is the fastest. On sea and rivers, a ship is used. You can equip a ship at the Baghdad port and sail to European cities. For traveling abroad, you need a travel permit. Additionally, you can use fetishes for moving: in the graves you may find a flying rug, Mahdi may give Borak for your use, and Iblis may teach you to use magic to move quickly from one place to another.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Permits
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: There are four different kinds of permits: export permit, travel permit, building permit, and work permit. You need an export permit to export spices and works of art. You also need a travel permit for yourself and your wife, if you leave the country. You always need a building permit to build more. A work permit is needed for working as a merchant in Europe.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Doctor
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The Arabs adopted the Hellenistic medical skills. They translated Greek medical books into Arabic and further developed the Greek knowledge. There have been hospitals and pharmacies in Baghdad for a long time. Doctor Al-Kazwini has been your family doctor since your grandparents' time. If you health deteriorates, you can visit his place.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Mahdi
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Mahdi, or the hidden imam, is the twelfth imam and the Shi'a Muslims believe that he has hidden himself and will eventually return to earth to save his own. In the game, Mahdi is your lower level mythical helper. He is fighting on the side of Allah against Iblis' power.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Carpet
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Carpets are luxury items, which you can buy and sell in the bazaar. Mostly they have been made in Seaman. You can also display them in museums. Luxury items can also be used for trying to bribe people.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Mosques
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Each Muslim city has a mosque where you can go to pray in Baghdad, Baku, Al-ladhaqiuya, Konya, Najaf, Anjudan. If you have enough cultural influence, you can found mosques also in European cities. If you do not have, Europeans will found churches in your country.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Spices
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Spices are your most important goods for trade. With money, you can buy cardemon seedlings or saffron bulbs. Cardemon seedlings are cheaper, but you will get a lower profit from them. Saffron bulbs are more expensive, but will give a better profit. You can cultivate land alone, which will take more of your time and the crops will be smaller, or you can hire yourself a farm worker.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Museum
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Building a museum in your home country will increase your influence. Museums can also be built abroad, if you have enough wealth and influence there. If your business expands too much abroad, you may be accused of disregarding your own culture. The accusations will stop when you build a museum to your own city. Museums can be used to display works of art and the following luxury products: ceramics, jewelry, rugs, fabrics, and treasures you have found.§§Please note that for some of the categories of items (like statues) you are allowed to place only one item the museum. This is why you cannot see the other items in the category once you have placed one of them in the museum. You can still see the rest of the items for that category in your inventory.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Mythical helper
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Mythical helpers are the manifestations of your own faith. They can provide supernatural help for your problems, both good and bad. Some helpers are content with good will and intentions; others demand a reward for their services. There are two levels of mythical helpers: lower and higher. Witches and saints may help you to contact mythical helpers.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Najaf
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Najaf is located about 150 kilometers south of Baghdad, by the river Euphrates. The shrine of Imam Ali is located there. The city is one of the most holy places for Shi'a Muslims. On the mountains nearby live several Sufi mystics, who are nomadic hermits. Nadir is one of them. He has his own hermit's cave, where you can go to ask for his advice.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Witch
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Even though Baghdad is an Islamic city, there are also practitioners of pre-Islamic occultism. The witch has a secret reception by the gate of the city wall. He pushes his fortune-telling services to passers-by. He can curse people and make love potions. If you need more powerful means, he can lead you to a mythical helper.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Opium
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The Sumerians in Babylon correlated poppy with euphoria and sleep. The word "opium" comes from a Greek word meaning "juice", which refers to latex obtained when cutting open the cores. Arab merchants spread the use of opium to India and China, where it was mainly used for treating diarrhea and dysentery. Opium was not smoked in the East before the 11th century AH. In Europe, however, the use of opium was widespread already in the middle of the 9th century AH. European alchemist doctor Paracelsus (868-918 AH) developed the opium tincture, laudanum.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Evil eye
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: From old times, one property connected with eyes has been the "evil eye", which has been believed to cause its target accidents and even death. Belief in the evil eye has been common in different times and in different parts of the world. People have tried to protect themselves from the evil eye by hiding and especially by using amulets. In the game, amulets will protect you from the evil eye.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Palace
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The palace belongs to the Baghdad caliph al-Fadl al-Mustarshid, who is of the Abbasid dynasty. His power is weak, though: the real power is in the hands of the Persian Shi'a-Buwayhids, so you have good chances of gaining an esteemed position in Baghdad. All permits in the caliphate are processed in the palace: trade and building permits. It is wise to be in good terms with them.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Bank
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the bank, you can mortgage your house or fields and get money against the mortgage. You can also buy more land in the bank. When you have founded businesses in Europe, the bank also acts as a currency exchange. The currency exchange only operates in peace time: if you are at war with another country, the currency exchange will not work. The monetary unit of your country is a silver dirham. The bank also acts as a currency exchange. The currency exchange only operates in peace time: if you are at war with another country, the currency exchange will not work.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Bar fighter
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: If you want to fight you should go to meet a bar fighter. He is easiest to find in the port of the city.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Perfumes
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Perfumes are luxury items, which you can buy and sell in the bazaar. Mostly they have been made in India or Persia. Luxury items can also be used for trying to bribe people.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Shrine
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Building a shrine will increase your appreciation and you will also get Hafaza and Mahdi on your side. When you have connected with them once, you can call them by praying for them in any shrine or mosque. Shrines can also be built abroad, if you have enough wealth and influence there.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Stranger
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You might meet new people when you are traveling in Europe. They might help your or not. Use all the tricks you know. Strangers are usually hanging around in the port of the city.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Restaurant
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the game, the restaurant is always located in the port of the city. Poets, musicians and miniature painters gather there. They help you to arrange parties. A restaurant is also a good place to get you a new friend.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Prayer
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can go and pray in mosques. This will improve your health and strengthen your relationship to Nadir, Mahdi and Hafaza.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Rosary
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: A rosary usually has 11, 33 or 99 beads, which a Muslim goes through with fingers while recalling the 99 most beautiful names or properties of God. You can use the rosary to call for Borak, who will take you to Mahdi. The rosary also acts as an amulet against the evil eye and curses.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Saffron
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Saffron is obtained from a bulbous plant that belongs to the family of crocuses. The pistils of a saffron flower are dried and used as a spice. The name saffron comes from the Arabic word za´fran, which means "yellow" a sacred color that the Buddhist monks chose as the color of their robes. Saffron is extremely expensive. 200 000 flowers must be picked by hand to get 450 grams of saffron. Long ago, saffron was valued as a women's love drug.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Port
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The port of Baghdad is located by the river Tigris from where ships can sail to the Persian Gulf. The port always has the need for additional workers. There is a recruiter, who hires people to work. If you are poor, you can get some manual work at the port. At the port you can also equip a ship for yourself and sail to other European countries. In every port, there is also the city restaurant and inn. In Baghdad you might also find the entrance to Sheitan’s Bazaar.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Shahdanag
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Shahdanag is Persian and means "king's grain" or cannabis seed. In the game, Mahdi gives you this to drink when you try to contact Hafaza for the first time.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Seeds and seedlings
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can buy spice and seeds and seedlings in the bazaar. Take good care of them and build a warehouse for them. It protects them from rats and robbers.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Buckles
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Buckles are fetishes that you can find in the graves of the Assyrian god kings. There are seven different types. In the grave of Tiglath-Pileser I, there is the buckle of the guardian god Ningizzia, which will protect your property. In the grave of Ashurbanipal, there is the buckle of the ear god Geshtu-e, which will protect you from slandering. In the grave of Eriba-Adad, there is the buckle of the growth god Tammuz, which will increase the growth in the fields. In the grave of Puzur-Ashur III, there is the buckle of the god Urshamb, which will give you success at sea voyages. In the grave of Sargon I, there is the buckle of the war god Qingu, which will help you in battles. In the grave of Shalim-Ahu, there is the buckle of the god Apsu, which will help you to sort out your personal relationships. In the grave of Ilu-Shuma, there is the buckle of the god Tiamat, which will help you to win the game.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Incense
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The southernmost part of Oman is one of the few places on earth where the olibanum tree, Boswellia thurifera, grows. Very valuable resin containing aromatic oils can be obtained from this tree. In May, trees are cut with a knife and they start producing latex in the cuts. When the latex is exposed to air, it hardens. In September, the resin can be harvested. This incense burns easily due to the oil it contains and it is also used as medicine.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Suleiman
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The flying rug called Suleiman from "The Thousand and One Nights". You can use it to move quickly from one place to another. You can find Suleiman in the graves of the Assyrian god kings.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Sufi saint
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Sufism is a mystical school of Islam that originally developed from asceticism. The name Sufi was first introduced in Baghdad, Iran. The goal of a Sufi saint is to become one with the God. It means that he goes "inside himself", empties himself of his own personality and God will then fills the empty space created. Sufi mystics, who live as nomadic hermits, can lead you to the mythical helpers.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Works of art
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the game, works of art include poems, miniatures and statues. These can also be sold abroad. Books of poems and miniatures can be placed in a library. Statues and miniatures can be placed in a museum. Works of art can be ordered from miniature painters, poets and artisans.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Fetishes
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Fetishes include masks of the Assyrian god kings, amulets and Suleiman that helps you to move faster, which can all be found in the graves. In the graves, you can also find a lamp occupied by a good dzinn. From Mahdi, you may get Borak for your use and a rosary with which to call him. Amulets will protect you from evil eye, curses and bad dzinns. Mahdi may give you shahdanag and the witch may give you love potion.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: artists
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the game, there are miniature painters, poems and artisans from whom you can order works of art. From a poet, you can order works for your library. If you need beautifully illustrated books, you need to turn to a miniature painter. Artisans will make you statues. You can call for a musician to play in your parties. The best place to find the artists is the restaurant at the port.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Health
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Muslims believed that Allah punishes people with diseases. Diseases can also be caused by the evil eye and dzinns, spirits that get inside you. The Arab hospitals of the time were of high quality and, for example, Baghdad, Damascus and Cairo had exemplary hospitals. According to Mohammed, the three most important cures were drinking honey, blood-letting and burning with hot iron. Cautering skin was previously used as a treatment for internal diseases as well. Treatment with medicine was common and there were a lot of medicines. Hashish and hyoscyamine were used as intoxicating and anesthetic substances.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Yima
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the Zarathustran religion, Yima is the son of Vivahvanti, who fed human flesh to an ox and brought evil into the world. He fights with Iblis against Allah and is a lower level mythical helper.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Wife
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In order to get married, you need to have certain amount of wealth and an influential position. You can have a maximum of four wives, if you can afford it.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Warehouse
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can build a warehouse near your fields to help storing the spices.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Enemies
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: By getting the initial capital, you have made your spice fields to flourish. You have sold your spices to European buyers: France, Germany, Austria, Hungary and Russia. Each country has different purchasing power. At the same time, the European enemy countries want to gain a spice monopoly and colonialize the caliphate. The enemy countries are getting nearer on each round, first Venice by land, then Portugal, Spain, England and Holland by sea. The more time you have used for getting money and cultivating your fields, the closer the enemies are.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Fields
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Your fields are outside the city of Baghdad. You can hire workers to cultivate your fields. You can also hire soldiers to guard your fields. You can build a warehouse for spices and seeds beside your fields. You can cultivate drugs or spices on your fields. If you need more land, you can buy it in the bank.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Farmer
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: With money, you can hire farm workers to work on your fields, which will give you larger crops faster. However, you need to give a share of the profits to the farm workers.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Official
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: An official works in the monarch's palace. You can apply for different permits from him. He may also come to inform you that you cannot do something, because you do not have the official permit required.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Recruiter
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The recruiter works at the port. You get work at the port through him. Also equipping a ship is done through him. He is always ready for all kind of business.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Luxury products
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: You can buy different luxury products for your home, as a gift to someone else or as a bribe. Mostly these are imported specialties or domestic quality goods. You can buy luxury products in the bazaar. Silk fabric and porcelain are imported from China, rugs and jewelry from Esfahan, incense from Oman, perfume from India, and coffee from Africa. Rugs, fabrics, ceramics and jewelry can also be displayed in museums.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Paris' Port
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The port of Paris is located by the river Seine from where ships can sail to the English Channel. At the port you can go to the wine bar and get some new friends.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Paris wine bar
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The wine bar is located at the port of Paris. The wine bar is a good place to find yourself a local friend.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Paris market place
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: At the Paris market place, you can sell your spices. When your business expands, you can rent yourself business premises by the market place. At the market place, you can also hire a merchant to take care of your business. Here you can also try to seduce a lover for yourself.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Bank of Paris
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the bank, you can rent business premises. The bank also acts as a currency exchange. The currency exchange only operates in peace time: if you are at war with another country, the currency exchange will not work.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Palace of the king Louis VI
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: France is ruled by Louis VI (487-516 AH). All permits in the country are processed in the palace: trade and building permits. It is wise to be in good terms with the palace personnel.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Hamburg's Port
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The port of Hamburg is located by the river Elbe from where ships can sail to the North Sea. At the port you can go to the wine bar and get some new friends.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Hamburg market place
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: At the Hamburg market place, you can sell your spices. When your business expands, you can rent yourself business premises by the market place.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Hamburg beerhouse
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: The beerhouse is located at the port of Hamburg. The beerhouse is a good place to find yourself a local friend.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Bank of Hamburg
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: In the bank, you can rent business premises. The bank also acts as a currency exchange. The currency exchange only operates in peace time: if you are at war with another country, the currency exchange will not work.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Representative palace of Rupert in Hamburg
org.spicetrade.tools.Item.description: Hamburg belongs to the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation. The king is Rupert (779-789 AH). He has his court in Prague, but his court also has representation in Hamburg. The representatives of his court process all permits: trade and building permits. It is wise to be in good terms with the palace personnel.

org.spicetrade.tools.Item.name: Vienna's Port
